lesson.title_and_level: Intermediate - Recovering a Cell Phone Number

sentence.idiomatic: I lost my bank card. I need to hurry up and report the loss.
Where should you go to report a missing driver's license?
Don't worry, as long as you have reported it as lost, other people can't use your card.
It's such a hassle to get another passport.
The patient hasn't finished the hospital check-in procedures. Have his family help him re-apply.
Have you successfully re-applied for a bank card?
Do you still remember him?
I remember there used to be a really good Sichuan restaurant here.
When did you tell me about that? I don't remember.
He definitely has to come pick it up in person. No one else can do it for him.
Is this your ID card? It really doesn't look like you.
I've seen her in person. She's as pretty as she is in the photo.
Tomorrow I'm going to school to take care of the matriculation procedures.
Do you want to get an Work Visa or a Student Visa?
Do you know what documents foreigners need to provide to get a residence permit?
I can't comprehend why he has to do it that way.
Do you understand the meaning of this sentence?
Friends should have some mutual understanding. They shouldn't be too selfish.
My cell phone is out of power. I need to recharge it.
I just put 100 RMB on your transport card, so you can use it now.
Go get a cell phone recharge card, and you'll be able to put money on your phone.
Have you filled out this application form?
Everyone coming for an interview must fill out a form.
You filled it out incorrectly, what you need to put here is your cell phone number.
A lot of people register their marriages on Valentine's Day.
Today is the last day for voter registration.
If you want to pick up office supplies, you need to check in here first.
Hello, I lost my cell phone. What should I do?
First report the lost number. If you still want to use this number, then you can reapply for it. What is your cell phone password?
I can't remember.
Did you use your own ID card to apply for the SIM card?
No. I bought it in a small shop. I didn't need an ID card.
Then, do you have the password card?
Password card? No.
Then there is no way we can help you.
Huh? Then the thief can use my SIM card?
Yes. I understand how you feel, but if you don't have the password, there's nothing I can do.
So the money I put on the card, all the information on the card--it's all gone?
How about this--fill out this form. If you fill it out correctly, you can get back your password.
Huh? All of these things--how can I remember them all?
That's why I said, when you buy a card, it's best to come to the company offices and formally register your name.
Ah.

word.literal: to report the loss of something
